episodeTitle: Light and Shadow - Darkness behind Dressrosa!
episodeTitleJapanese: 光と影 ドレスローザに潜む闇
episodeTitleRomanized: Hikari to Kage - Doresurōza ni Hisomu Yami!
description: At the Corrida Colosseum, Luffy faces off against Don Chinjao who reveals that the King of the Pirates must conquer all conquerors in the New World. Meanwhile, the Thunder Soldier reveals to Franky the dark secret of Dressrosa - all toys were once humans transformed and forgotten by their loved ones. The Tontatta dwarves explain their mission to rescue 500 captives including Princess Mansherry from Doflamingo's dark factory hidden beneath the colosseum. At Green Bit, Law struggles against the combined assault of Admiral Fujitora and Doflamingo.

events.title: Chinjao Explains What It Means to Become Pirate King
events.description: In the Corrida Colosseum, Don Chinjao tells Luffy that the King of the Pirates is not just about finding the One Piece, but about conquering all the conquerors in the New World. He explains that countless powerful warriors are vying for the throne, and only one who defeats them all can claim the title.
events.significance: This statement reframes the journey to become Pirate King as not merely a treasure hunt, but a battle against all the most powerful individuals in the world. It emphasizes the competitive nature of the New World and foreshadows future conflicts.

quotes.text: The King of the Pirates is one who conquers all the conquerors in the New World!
quotes.speaker: Don Chinjao
quotes.context: Chinjao explaining to Luffy what it truly means to become Pirate King

events.title: Chinjao's Grudge Against Garp
events.description: Chinjao begins crying as he struggles to remember what Monkey D. Garp did to him in the past. He demands answers from Luffy about Garp's actions, though Luffy has no knowledge of what happened between them. Chinjao's emotional state reveals the depth of his trauma and grudge.
events.significance: This reveals that Garp's past actions have left lasting impacts on many powerful individuals. Chinjao's grudge against Garp creates personal stakes in his fight with Luffy and hints at Garp's legendary battles.

events.title: Sanji and Kin'emon Observe in Disguise
events.description: Outside the Corrida Colosseum, Sanji and Kin'emon watch Luffy's battle while disguised among the crowds. They observe the numerous marines surrounding the colosseum, waiting to arrest any criminals who exit the stadium.
events.significance: This scene establishes the dangerous situation surrounding the tournament and shows the Straw Hats' need for caution. It also demonstrates the Marines' strategic positioning to capture pirates.

events.title: Vice Admiral Bastille Questions Missing Losers
events.description: Vice Admiral Bastille, commanding the Marines outside the colosseum, becomes confused and suspicious when not a single loser from the Battle Royales emerges from the stadium. He also wonders why they haven't heard from Maynard in so long, sensing something is wrong inside the colosseum.
events.significance: This moment foreshadows the dark truth about what happens to losers in the tournament - they are being turned into toys. It builds tension and mystery around the colosseum's true purpose.

events.title: Thunder Soldier Reveals Doflamingo's Curfew Between Humans and Toys
events.description: The Thunder Soldier explains to Franky that ten years ago when Doflamingo took over Dressrosa, he imposed a strict curfew between humans and toys. This revelation hints at the dark truth behind the living toys on the island.
events.significance: This is the first major clue about Doflamingo's sinister control over Dressrosa and the unnatural relationship between humans and toys. It sets up the revelation of Sugar's powers and the true nature of the toys.

events.title: Thunder Soldier Reveals the Truth About Dressrosa's Toys
events.description: The Thunder Soldier reveals the horrifying truth to Franky: every toy on the island was once a human being who was transformed and then completely forgotten by their loved ones. This transformation was caused by a Devil Fruit user working for Doflamingo who came to power ten years ago.
events.significance: This is one of the most devastating reveals in the Dressrosa arc, explaining the true horror of Doflamingo's reign. It recontextualizes every scene with toys and explains why families and friends have no memory of the missing people.

quotes.text: Every toy in the island were once humans who became forgotten to their loved ones.
quotes.speaker: Thunder Soldier
quotes.context: Revealing the dark secret of Dressrosa's toys to Franky

events.title: Leo Reveals 500 Dwarves Are Held Captive Including Princess Mansherry
events.description: Leo, leader of the Tontatta Tribe's warrior division, explains to Usopp and Robin why they want to battle Doflamingo. He reveals that 500 dwarves are held captive in Doflamingo's dark factory on Dressrosa, including their beloved Princess Mansherry.
events.significance: This revelation provides the dwarves' motivation for their rebellion and introduces Princess Mansherry as an important character. It shows the extent of Doflamingo's cruelty and his use of hostages to maintain control.

quotes.text: 500 dwarves are held captive in the dark factory on Dressrosa, including the kingdom's princess, Mansherry.
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: Explaining to Usopp why the Tontatta must fight Doflamingo

events.title: The Dark Factory Revealed to Be Under the Corrida Colosseum
events.description: Leo reveals that Doflamingo's dark factory, where the 500 dwarves are enslaved and where the SMILE artificial Devil Fruits are produced, is hidden in the basement directly beneath the Corrida Colosseum - right under Luffy's feet.
events.significance: This revelation connects multiple storylines and locations, showing that Luffy is unknowingly fighting directly above the factory. It sets up the eventual convergence of all the plot threads and the factory's importance to the arc.

quotes.text: The decisive battle will be in the dark factory, under the Corrida Colosseum!
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: Revealing the location of the SMILE factory to Usopp and Robin

events.title: Law Struggles Against Fujitora and Doflamingo at Green Bit
events.description: At Green Bit, Trafalgar Law is barely holding his defense against the combined assault of Admiral Issho (Fujitora) and Warlord Donquixote Doflamingo. The overwhelming power of both opponents puts Law at a severe disadvantage as he struggles to protect himself.
events.significance: This battle demonstrates the massive gap in power between Law and two of the strongest characters in the series. It shows the danger of the alliance's situation and foreshadows Law's eventual defeat and capture.

events.title: Tontatta Kingdom Shakes from Green Bit Battle
events.description: The underground Tontatta Kingdom shakes from the intense battle happening above them on Green Bit between Law, Fujitora, and Doflamingo. The dwarves mistakenly believe the shaking is caused by Usopp's Haki, further cementing their belief in his legendary status.
events.significance: This moment adds humor while showing the scale of the battle at Green Bit. It also reinforces the dwarves' misunderstanding of Usopp's abilities, which becomes important later.

events.title: Law Fails to Contact Nami via Den Den Mushi
events.description: During the battle at Green Bit, Law attempts to contact Nami via his Den Den Mushi transponder snail but fails to get through. This communication failure adds to the mounting problems facing the Straw Hat-Heart Pirates alliance.
events.significance: This shows the isolation and danger of Law's situation. His inability to warn his allies or call for help emphasizes how dire his circumstances have become.

themes.description: The episode contrasts the festive appearance of Dressrosa with the horrifying truth hidden beneath - transformed humans, enslaved dwarves, and a secret factory. The title 'Light and Shadow' perfectly encapsulates this duality.
themes.symbolism: The SMILE factory hidden beneath the colosseum symbolizes how entertainment and spectacle can mask exploitation and suffering.
culturalReferences: The theme of forgotten people mirrors real-world issues of historical erasure and disappeared persons.

themes.description: The revelation that transformed toys are forgotten by their loved ones explores the connection between memory and existence. When someone is forgotten, do they still matter?
themes.symbolism: The toys represent people who have been erased from history and memory, existing but not truly living.

themes.description: Chinjao's explanation that becoming Pirate King requires conquering all conquerors emphasizes the brutal competition and sacrifice required to achieve the ultimate dream.
themes.symbolism: The New World's conquerors represent the various obstacles and trials one must overcome to achieve greatness.

characterSpotlights.development: The Thunder Soldier takes the crucial step of revealing Dressrosa's dark secret to Franky, showing his commitment to ending Doflamingo's tyranny despite the emotional pain of discussing what happened to him and others.

quotes: Every toy in the island were once humans who became forgotten to their loved ones.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded on the scenes of Sanji and Kin'emon observing the colosseum, adding more dialogue and reaction shots.
Additional scenes showing Vice Admiral Bastille's suspicions were added to build tension.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 717 (pages 3-19) of the One Piece manga.
The episode originally aired on June 1, 2014 in Japan, but the English dub didn't release until December 29, 2020 - more than 6 years later.
This episode marks the first time Mansherry is mentioned by name, though she won't appear physically for many more episodes.
The revelation about Dressrosa's toys being transformed humans is one of the darkest plot twists in the entire One Piece series.
The Thunder Soldier's voice actor, Hōchū Ōtsuka, also voices Don Chinjao in the same episode.
